Concealability.name: Concealability
Concealability.page: Adjusts the character's ability to conceal Weapons by the value entered. This bonus applies to the Concealability of all Weapons. Positive values improve Concealability. Negative values reduce Concealability.

Claws (Retractable).name: Claws (Retractable)
Claws (Retractable).notes: Rating is used to indicate number of claws.

Striking Callus.name: Striking Callus
Striking Callus.notes: Rating is used to represent hands and feet. Every 2 Rating will grant +1 Unarmed damage.

Tusk(s), Small.name: Tusk(s), Small
Tusk(s), Small.notes: Rating is used to indicate number of tusks.

Tusk(s), Medium.name: Tusk(s), Medium
Tusk(s), Medium.notes: Rating is used to indicate number of tusks.

Tusk(s), Large.name: Tusk(s), Large
Tusk(s), Large.notes: Rating is used to indicate number of tusks.

limitmodifier.condition: only for Stealth skills, Must be completely naked
Only for Stealth skills, Must be completely naked

Shadows In Focus: San Francisco Metrople.name: Shadows In Focus: San Francisco Metroplex

State of the Art ADL (German Handbook).name: State of the Art ADL (German Handbook)

Bear.name: Bear
Bear.advantage: All: +2 dice for tests to resist damage (not including drain).
Bear.disadvantage: You might go berserk when you take Physical damage in combat or if someone under your care is badly injured. Make a Simple Charisma + Willpower Test (wound modifiers apply). You go berserk for 3 turns minus 1 turn per hit, so 3 or more hits averts the berserk rage entirely. If you’re already going berserk, increase the duration. When you’re berserk, you go after your attacker(s) without regard for your own safety. If you incapacitate the target(s) before the time is up, the berserk fury dissipates.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Health spells
Adept: 1 free level of Rapid Healing

Dog.name: Dog
Dog.disadvantage: A Dog magician is stubbornly loyal. You can never leave someone behind, betray your comrades, or let another sacrifice themselves in your place without making a successful Charisma + Willpower (3) Test.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Detection spells
Adept: 2 free Improved Sense powers

Horse.name: Horse
Horse.advantage: All: +2 dice to Running or Pilot Ground Craft) tests (choose one)
Horse.disadvantage: Followers of the Horse can’t sit still for long nor be confined indoors. They must spend at least four hours a day outside and be able to run or drive around (any method of travel faster than walking). If followers are not able to meet this condition, they suffer –1 die to all action skill tests. This penalty is cumulative, meaning if the follower is stuck at a desk all day (indoors and not moving around) for two days in a a row, they suffer –2 to all actions until they get that free time in.

choice.name: +2 dice on Running tests
+2 on Pilot (Groundcraft) Tests
Magician: Reduce Drain Value from Reckless Summoning by 1
Adept: May learn to use the Movement critter power as a metamagic (self only, 3 times a day)

Shark.name: Shark
Shark.advantage: All: +2 dice to Unarmed Combat tests.
Shark.disadvantage: You might go berserk when you take Physical damage in combat. Every time it happens, make a Simple Charisma + Willpower Test (wound modifiers apply). You go berserk for 3 turns minus 1 turn per hit, so 3 or more hits averts the berserk rage entirely. If you’re already going berserk, increase the duration. When you’re berserk, you go after your attacker(s) without regard for your own safety. If you run out of targets before the time’s up, you keep attacking their bodies.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Combat spells
Adept: Free Killing Hands

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.disadvantage: You must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to retreat from a fight.

choice.name: Magician:+2 dice for Combat spells
Adept: 2 free levels of Attribute Boost (Agility)

Dolphin.name: Dolphin
Dolphin.advantage: All: +2 dice on Artisan skill tests or Pilot (Watercraft) skill tests (choose one)
Dolphin.disadvantage: Followers are altruistic when it comes to helping people and cannot turn a blind eye to those who they believe deserve their help. It is difficult for them not to get involved when they see someone being bullied or obviously polluting the environment. If they see such a situation, it takes a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test for a follower of Dolphin not to intervene. If the job that the follower of Dolphin is on involves polluting the environment or becoming the bully/enforcer on those less deserving, then the follower loses 2 dice after each such deed until she atones. Atonement is up to the gamemaster but can involve time and money spent with charities.

choice.name: +2 dice on Artisan tests
+2 on Pilot (Watercraft) Tests
Magician: +2 for health spells, preparations, and spell rituals.
Adept: Gain Flexibility (2) power for free

Seal.name: Seal
Seal.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Judge Intentions tests.
Seal.disadvantage: Seal has compassion, but she is lacking in tact dealing with the feelings of others. Whenever a follower of Seal gains insight into the emotional world of an other, it's difficult for him to respect private boundaries and not address the subject. In order to remain discreet in such situations, they must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) test. Glitches in social test are automatically critical.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice summoning spirits of water.
Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Illusion spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain the Astral Perception Power for free.

Alligator.name: Alligator
Alligator.disadvantage: A follower of Alligator is stubborn about changing a plan or action to which he is committed. When the rest of the team goes to Plan B, the magician must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test for the magician to stop trying Plan A.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for conjuring spirits of Water or Man (Choose one.)
Adept: Free Inertia Strike

Boar.name: Boar
Boar.advantage: All: Home Ground Quality is gained for free.
Boar.disadvantage: A follower of Boar does not like it if there are others intruding in his space or disrupting his routine. At best, the follower protects the bar and employees of the bar he always goes to. At worst, he will start a fight for a specific table or stool that he thinks is his. A warning is optional and usually proffered by the follower’s friends. It takes a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test for a follower of Boar to leave his home, safehouse, or routine permanently, otherwise he will keep coming back, even at the risk of his own safety. If the Boar does leave, he receives a –1 penalty to all active skill tests for three weeks until he finally settles into a new place and routine.

choice.name: Magician: +1 to the number of services gained when successfully summoning a spirit
Adept: Gains Rooting (2) power for free.

Rat.name: Rat
Rat.disadvantage: A Rat magician must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to not immediately flee or seek cover whenever caught in a combat situation. If there is nowhere to flee, she is forced to fight.

choice.name: Magician: +2 to Alchemy for harvesting, and you may use any reagents
Adept: 2 free levels of Natural Immunity

Giraffe.name: Giraffe
Giraffe.advantage: All: +2 Assensing skill tests or +2 to Judge Intentions test (choose one)
Giraffe.disadvantage: A follower of Giraffe stumbles through social etiquette, as she believes the small talk and chitchat that are the core of social chatter are fundamentally dishonest and not worthy of her efforts. She can make a wide range of situations awkward and receives –2 dice for Etiquette skill tests.

choice.name: +2 dice on Assensing Tets
+2 on Judge Intentions Tests
Magician: +2 to Conjuring skill tests of air spirits
Adept: 2 free levels of Piercing Senses

Fox.name: Fox
Fox.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Perception skill.
Fox.disadvantage: If Fox fights, it'll fight to kill. A follower of this mentor spirit must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to spare a bettered foe.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Illusion spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Combat Sense.

Raccoon.name: Raccoon
Raccoon.disadvantage: The Raccoon is commonly one of the Thief totems, so the followers can tend to err on the side of greed. A follower of Raccoon must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to resist the urge to open that next locked door to look for something to steal, or to follow that Matrix rabbit trail in the quest for more paydata.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for spells, preparations, and spell rituals in the Manipulation category.
Adept: 2 Improved Sense powers

Snake.name: Snake
Snake.disadvantage: You must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to avoid pursuing secrets or knowledge that few people know about when you receive hints of its existence.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Detection spells
Adept: 2 free levels of Kinesics

Spider.name: Spider
Spider.advantage: All:+2 dice to Computer skill tests
Spider.disadvantage: Followers of Spider are already paranoid about people having any misconceptions about them being insect shamans. They will keep such detailsfrom casual conversation. Followers of Spider also have taken advantage of the Matrix more than more traditional shamas in creating connections. This makes followers more agoraphobic as they avoid uncontrolled social situations and unfamiliar environments. They receive a –1 dice pool modifier to Magic tests while out in the open (this includes very large indoor rooms such as auditoriums, theatres, and stadiums). The penalty doubles if there is a large crowd of people to deal with.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion spells
Adept: Hang time (2)

Raven.name: Raven
Raven.disadvantage: You must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to avoid exploiting someone else’s misfortune to your own advantage or to pull a clever trick or prank even if it’s to the disadvantage of your friends.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Manipulation spells
Adept: Free Traceless Walk and 1 level of Voice Control

Bat.name: Bat
Bat.disadvantage: A follower of Bat is easily distracted and becomes irritable during enforced inaction. She prefers spontaneity to routine. Every week that the magician stays in the same place, she takes a –1 penalty to all actions until she finds a new place to stay. Also, unless she succeeds in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test, she cannot enter a hangout (bar, club, restaurant) more than once in a week without suffering a –1 to all Magic tests for the next twenty-four hours.

choice.name: Magician: +1 dice for conjuring spirits.
Adept: Free motion sense

Eagle.name: Eagle
Eagle.disadvantage: You get the Allergy (pollutants, mild) quality (p. 322; no bonus Karma for this negative quality).

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice summoning spirits of air
Adept: 1 free level of Combat Sense

Thunderbird.name: Thunderbird
Thunderbird.disadvantage: A Thunderbird magician must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to avoid responding to an insult in kind.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for summoning spirits of air
Adept: 1 free level of Critical Strike

Green Man.name: Green Man
Green Man.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Negotiation Tests.
Green Man.disadvantage: When signifcant damage is being done to vegetation, they must pass a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test or use all means possible to stop the destruction.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer to summon Plant Spirits.
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Rooting.

limitmodifier.condition: Only for Perception to find source of a sound

Bone Lacing (Aluminum).name: Bone Lacing (Aluminum)
Bone Lacing (Aluminum).notes: Bone Lacing does not increase your BOD score, only tests for resisting damage.

Bone Lacing (Plastic).name: Bone Lacing (Plastic)
Bone Lacing (Plastic).notes: Bone Lacing does not increase your BOD score, only tests for resisting damage.

Bone Lacing (Titanium).name: Bone Lacing (Titanium)
Bone Lacing (Titanium).notes: Bone Lacing does not increase your BOD score, only tests for resisting damage.

Vocal Tension Lie Detection (1 Month Adv.name: Vocal Tension Lie Detection (1 Month Advance Payment)

Snuff.name: Snuff
Snuff.disadvantage: Snuff technomancer suffer a –2 dice pool modifier to resisting addiction to BTL or Matrix media.

choice.name: +1 die for dissonant Crack sprites
+1 die for dissonant Sleuth sprites

Street Vender Food (Hot Dog, Burrito, Bo.name: Street Vender Food (Hot Dog, Burrito, Bowl of Ramen, etc)

Box Rental for Ten at a Sporting Event.name: Box Rental for Ten at a Sporting Event

limitmodifier.condition: Only for First Aid and Medicine

Enable Special Attribute.name: Enable Special Attribute
Enable Special Attribute.page: Unlocks the controls for an attribute, allowing the values to be increased. Expected values are MAG, RES or DEP for Magic, Resonance and Depth respectively.

Attribute.name: Attribute
Attribute.page: Adjusts the values for one of the character's Attributes. Positive numbers increase an Attribute. Negative numbers decrease an Attribute. Select an Attribute to affect by clicking the Select Value button. Value adjusts the Attribute's current value. Minimum adjusts the Metatype's minimum value for the Attribute. Maximum adjusts the Metatype's maximum value for the Attribute. Metatype augmented maximum values are automatically adjusted based on the new Metatype maximum. Fields may be left at 0 if you do not want to affect that particular aspect of the Attribute.

Replace Attribute.name: Replace Attribute
Replace Attribute.page: Overrides the Metatype limitations for an attribute. Minimum adjusts the Metatype's minimum value for the Attribute. Maximum adjusts the Metatype's maximum value for the Attribute. Metatype augmented maximum values are automatically adjusted based on the new Metatype maximum.

Enable Spells and Spirits Tab.name: Enable Spells and Spirits Tab
Enable Spells and Spirits Tab.page: Enables the character's Spells and Spirits tab, allowing them to buy spells and bind spirits. The character is flagged as a Magician, but does not receive access to the Initiation tab, unlock their Magic attribute or receive any of the Magical skills.

Enable Technomancer Tab.name: Enable Technomancer Tab
Enable Technomancer Tab.page: Enables the character's 'Complex Forms and Sprites' tab, allowing them to purchase Complex Forms and compile Sprites. The character is flagged as a Technomancer for the purposes of quality requirements, but does not receive access to the Submersion tab, unlock their Resonance attribute or receive any of the Resonance skills. Incompatible with improvements that enable the Spells and Spirits tab.

Enable Initiation/Submersion Tab.name: Enable Initiation/Submersion Tab
Enable Initiation/Submersion Tab.page: Enables the character's Adept Powers tab, allowing them to buy spells and bind spirits. The character receives access to the Initiation tab, or the Submersion tab for Technomancers.

Enable Critter Tab.name: Enable Critter Tab
Enable Critter Tab.page: Enables the character's Critter Powers tab, allowing them to buy critter powers. The character is flagged as a Critter.

Cyber-Singularity Seeker/Redliner (Attri.name: Cyber-Singularity Seeker/Redliner (Attribute)
Cyber-Singularity Seeker/Redliner (Attri.page: Grants bonuses to the specified attribute based on the number of cyberlimbs a character has. Special attributes are invalid

Cyber-Singularity Seeker/Redliner (Condi.name: Cyber-Singularity Seeker/Redliner (Condition Monitor)
Cyber-Singularity Seeker/Redliner (Condi.page: Grants bonuses to the character's physical Condition Monitor based on the number of cyberlimbs a character has. See Redliner in Chrome Flesh for more details.

Condition Monitor, Physical.name: Condition Monitor, Physical
Condition Monitor, Physical.page: Adjusts the number of boxes the character has in their Physical Condition Monitor. Positive numbers increase the number of boxes in the Condition Monitor. Negative numbers reduce the number of boxes in the Condition Monitor.

Condition Monitor, Stun.name: Condition Monitor, Stun
Condition Monitor, Stun.page: Adjusts the number of boxes the character has in their Stun Condition Monitor. Positive numbers increase the number of boxes in the Condition Monitor. Negative numbers reduce the number of boxes in the Condition Monitor.

Condition Monitor, Threshold.name: Condition Monitor, Threshold
Condition Monitor, Threshold.page: Adjusts the number of boxes between each Condition Monitor Threshold. Positive numbers increase the number of boxes between each Threshold. Negative numbers reduce the number of boxes between each Threshold.

Condition Monitor, Threshold Offset.name: Condition Monitor, Threshold Offset
Condition Monitor, Threshold Offset.page: Adjusts the number of boxes between the start of each Condition Monitor and the first Threshold. Positive numbers increase the starting position of the first Threshold. Negative numbers reduce the starting position of each Threshold.

Block Skillgroup Defaulting.name: Block Skillgroup Defaulting
Block Skillgroup Defaulting.page: Prevents the character from seeing dicepool values for skills in the selected skillgroup.

Attribute Level.name: Attribute Level
Attribute Level.page: Adds to the selected attribute's base Value, increasing Karma costs for subsequent purchases.

Skill Level.name: Skill Level
Skill Level.page: Adds to the selected attribute's base Value, increasing Karma costs for subsequent purchases.

KnowSoft.name: KnowSoft
KnowSoft.page: Creates a Knowledge Skill that requires the skillsoftaccess improvement to be activated.

Adept Power.name: Adept Power
Adept Power.page: Creates a free Adept Power. If the selected power already exists, the power will either be marked as free, or have free levels added to it.

Living Persona, Biofeedback Filter.name: Living Persona, Biofeedback Filter
Living Persona, Biofeedback Filter.page: Adjusts the Living Persona's Biofeedback Filter Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve the Biofeedback Filter Rating. Negative numbers reduce the Biofeedback Filter Rating. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Living Persona.

Living Persona, Firewall.name: Living Persona, Firewall
Living Persona, Firewall.page: Adjusts the Living Persona's Firewall Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve the Firewall Rating. Negative numbers reduce the Firewall Rating. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Living Persona.

Living Persona, Response.name: Living Persona, Response
Living Persona, Response.page: Adjusts the Living Persona's Response Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve the Response Rating. Negative numbers reduce the Response Rating. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Living Persona.

Living Persona, Signal.name: Living Persona, Signal
Living Persona, Signal.page: Adjusts the Living Persona's Signal Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve the Signal Rating. Negative numbers reduce the Signal Rating. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Living Persona.

Living Persona, System.name: Living Persona, System
Living Persona, System.page: Adjusts the Living Persona's System Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve the System Rating. Negative numbers reduce the System Rating. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Living Persona.

Skill.name: Skill
Skill.page: Adjusts the value for one of the character's Skills by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Skill. Negative numbers decrease the Skill. Select a Skill to affect by clicking the Select Value button. The modifier can be applied to the Skill's Rating by selecting Apply to Rating, otherwise the modifier is applied as a dice pool modifier.

Skills in Category.name: Skills in Category
Skills in Category.page: Adjusts the value for all of the Skills in one category by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Skills. Negative numbers decrease the Skills. Select a Skill category to affect by clicking the Select Value button. The modifier can be applied to the Skills' Ratings by selecting Apply to Rating, otherwise the modifier is applied as a dice pool modifier.

Skills in Group.name: Skills in Group
Skills in Group.page: Adjusts the value for all of the Skills in a Skill Group by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Skills. Negative numbers decrease the Skills. Select a Skill Group to affect by clicking the Select Value button. The modifier can be applied to the Skills' Ratings by selecting Apply to Rating, otherwise the modifier is applied as a dice pool modifier.

Skills linked to Attribute.name: Skills linked to Attribute
Skills linked to Attribute.page: Adjusts the value for all of the Skills linked to an Attribute by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Skills. Negative numbers decrease the Skills. Select a linked Attribute to affect by clicking the Select Value button. The modifier can be applied to the Skills' Ratings by selecting Apply to Rating, otherwise the modifier is applied as a dice pool modifier.

Armor, Ballistic.name: Armor, Ballistic
Armor, Ballistic.page: Adjusts the character's Ballistic Armor Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve Ballistic Armor. Negative numbers reduce Ballistic Armor.

Armor, Impact.name: Armor, Impact
Armor, Impact.page: Adjusts the character's Impact Armor Rating by the value entered. Positive numbers improve Impact Armor. Negative numbers reduce Impact Armor.

Reach.name: Reach
Reach.page: Adjusts the character's Reach by the value entered. Positive numbers increase Reach. Negative numbers reduce Reach.

Unarmed DV.name: Unarmed DV
Unarmed DV.page: Adjusts the Damage Value for a character's Unarmed Attacks by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Damage Value. Negative numbers decrease the Damage Value.

Unarmed DV Physical.name: Unarmed DV Physical
Unarmed DV Physical.page: All of the character's Unarmed Attacks will do Physical damage instead of Stun damage.

Unarmed AP.name: Unarmed AP
Unarmed AP.page: Adjusts the Armor Penetration value for a character's Unarmed Attacks by the value entered. Positive numbers reduce Armor Penetration. Negative numbers increase Armor Penetration.

Initiative.name: Initiative
Initiative.page: Adjusts the character's Initiative by the value entered. Positive numbers increase Initiative. Negative numbers reduce Initiative.

Initiative Passes.name: Initiative Passes
Initiative Passes.page: Adjusts the number of Initiative Passes the character receives by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the number of Initiative Passes. Negative numbers reduce the number of Initiative Passes.

Matrix Initiative.name: Matrix Initiative
Matrix Initiative.page: Adjusts the character's Matrix Initiative by the value entered. Positive numbers increase Matrix Initiative. Negative numbers reduce Matrix Initiative.

Matrix Initiative Passes.name: Matrix Initiative Passes
Matrix Initiative Passes.page: Adjusts the number of Matrix Initiative Passes the character receives by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the number of Matrix Initiative Passes. Negative numbers reduce the number of Matrix Initiative Passes.

Lifestyle Cost.name: Lifestyle Cost
Lifestyle Cost.page: Adjusts the Nuyen cost of all Lifestyles by the percent value entered. All Lifestyles will now cost an additional X% per month. Positive number increase the Lifestyle's monthly Nuyen cost. Negative numbers reduce the Lifestyle's monthly Nuyen cost.

Genetech Cost.name: Genetech Cost
Genetech Cost.page: Adjusts the Nuyen cost of Bioware in the Genetech categories by the percent value entered. All Genetech Nuyen costs will now be X% of their original value. Numbers lower than 100 reduce the Nuyen cost. Numbers higher than 100 increase the Nuyen cost.

Transgenics Cost.name: Transgenics Cost
Transgenics Cost.page: Adjusts the Nuyen cost of Bioware in the Genetech: Transgenics category by the percent value entered. All Transgenics Nuyen costs will now be X% of their original value. Numbers lower than 100 reduce the Nuyen cost. Numbers higher than 100 increase the Nuyen cost.

Basic Bioware Essence Cost.name: Basic Bioware Essence Cost
Basic Bioware Essence Cost.page: Adjusts the Essence cost of Bioware in the Basic category by the percent value entered. All Basic Bioware Essence costs will now be X% of their original value. Numbers lower than 100 reduce the Essence cost. Numbers higher than 100 increase the Essence cost.

Bioware Essence Cost.name: Bioware Essence Cost
Bioware Essence Cost.page: Adjusts the Essence cost of Bioware by the percent value entered. All Bioware Essence costs will now be X% of their original value. Numbers lower than 100 reduce the Essence cost. Numbers higher than 100 increase the Essence cost.

Cyberware Essence Cost.name: Cyberware Essence Cost
Cyberware Essence Cost.page: Adjusts the Essence cost of Cyberware by the percent value entered. All Cyberware Essence costs will now be X% of their original value. Numbers lower than 100 reduce the Essence cost. Numbers higher than 100 increase the Essence cost.

Weapon Category DV.name: Weapon Category DV
Weapon Category DV.page: Adjusts the Damage Value of all Weapons in the selected category by the value entered. Positive numbers increase Weapon Damage Value. Negative numbers decrease Weapon Damage Value.

Movement Percent.name: Movement Percent
Movement Percent.page: Adjusts a character's Movement speed by the percent value entered. Positive numbers increase Movement speed. Negative numbers reduce Movement speed. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Movement speed.

Swim Percent.name: Swim Percent
Swim Percent.page: Adjusts a character's Swim speed by the percent value entered. Positive numbers increase Swim speed. Negative numbers reduce Swim speed. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Swim speed.

Fly Percent.name: Fly Percent
Fly Percent.page: Adjusts a character's Fly speed by the percent value entered. Positive numbers increase Fly speed. Negative numbers reduce Fly speed. This has no effect on characters that do not have a Fly speed.

Fly Speed.name: Fly Speed
Fly Speed.page: Grants a character a Fly speed of the value entered if they do not already have one. This has no effect on characters that already have a Fly speed.

Power Points, Free Spirit.name: Power Points, Free Spirit
Power Points, Free Spirit.page: Adjusts the number of Power Points a Free Spirit receives to spend on Critter Powers by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the number of Power Points. Negative numbers decrease the number of Power Points. This has no effect on non-Free Spirit characters.

Power Points, Adept.name: Power Points, Adept
Power Points, Adept.page: Adjusts the number of Power Points an Adept receives to spend on Adept Powers by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the number of Power Points. Negative numbers decrease the number of Power Points. This has no effect on non-Adept characters.

Armor Encumbrance Penalty.name: Armor Encumbrance Penalty
Armor Encumbrance Penalty.page: Adjusts the character's Armor Encumbrance penalty by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Armor Encumbrance penalty (bad). Negative numbers decrease the Armor Encumbrance penalty (good).

Damage Resistance.name: Damage Resistance
Damage Resistance.page: Adjusts the size of the character's Damage Resistance Test dice pool by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the size of the pool. Negative numbers decrease the size of the pool.

Judge Intentions.name: Judge Intentions
Judge Intentions.page: Adjusts the character's Judge Intentions Special Attribute by the value entered. Positive numbers improve Judge Intentions. Negative numbers reduce Judge Intentions.

Composure.name: Composure
Composure.page: Adjusts the character's Composure Special Attribute by the value entered. Positive numbers improve Composure. Negative numbers reduce Composure.

Lift and Carry.name: Lift and Carry
Lift and Carry.page: Adjusts the character's Lift and Carry Special Attribute by the value entered. Positive numbers improve Lift and Carry. Negative numbers reduce Lift and Carry.

Memory.name: Memory
Memory.page: Adjusts the character's Memory Special Attribute by the value entered. Positive numbers improve Memory. Negative numbers reduce Memory.

Drain Resistance.name: Drain Resistance
Drain Resistance.page: Adjusts the size of the character's Drain Resistance pool by the value entered. Positive values increase the size of the pool. Negative values decrease the size of the pool.

Fading Resistance.name: Fading Resistance
Fading Resistance.page: Adjusts the size of the character's Fading Resistance pool by the value entered. Positive values increase the size of the pool. Negative values decrease the size of the pool.

Spells in Category.name: Spells in Category
Spells in Category.page: Adjusts the size of the character's Spellcasting pool when casting Spell in the selected category. Positive values improve Spellcasting. Negative values reduce Spellcasting.

Skillsoft Access.name: Skillsoft Access
Skillsoft Access.page: The character can use Knowsoft and Linguasoft Skillsofts as though they had a direct neural link.

Essence.name: Essence
Essence.page: Adjusts the character's Essence by the value entered. Positive values increase Essence. Negative values decrease Essence.

Essence Maximum.name: Essence Maximum
Essence Maximum.page: Adjusts the character's Maximum Essence by the value entered. Positive values increase Maximum Essence. Negative values decrease Maximum Essence.

Throwing Weapon Range.name: Throwing Weapon Range
Throwing Weapon Range.page: Adjusts a character's STR for the purpose of determining the range of Throwing Weapons. Positive numbers increase the character's effective STR. Negative numbers reduce the character's effective STR.

Skillwire Rating.name: Skillwire Rating
Skillwire Rating.page: Grants the character access to Skillwires at the specified Rating which limits the effective Rating of all Skillsofts the character takes.

Swap Skill Attribute (Physical for Menta.name: Swap Skill Attribute (Physical for Mental)
Swap Skill Attribute (Physical for Menta.page: Swaps the Physical Attribute used by Active Skills with the corresponding Mental Attribute as described in the Astral Attributes table on SR4 192. (AGI/LOG; BOD/WIL; REA/INT; STR/CHA)

Basic Lifestyle Cost.name: Basic Lifestyle Cost
Basic Lifestyle Cost.page: Adjusts the Nuyen cost of all basic Lifestyles by the percent value entered. All basic Lifestyles will now cost an additional X% per month. Basic Lifestyles are only those found in the SR4 book and do not include Advanced Lifestyles, Safehouses, or Bolt Holes. Positive number increase the basic Lifestyle's monthly Nuyen cost. Negative numbers reduce the basic Lifestyle's monthly Nuyen cost.

Throwing Weapon STR.name: Throwing Weapon STR
Throwing Weapon STR.page: Adjusts a character's STR for the purpose of determining the DV of Throwing Weapons. Positive numbers increase the character's effective STR. Negative numbers reduce the character's effective STR.

Knowledge Skill.name: Knowledge Skill
Knowledge Skill.page: Adjusts the value for one of the character's Knowledge Skills by the value entered. Positive numbers increase the Knowledge Skill. Negative numbers decrease the Knowledge Skill. Select a Knowledge Skill to affect by clicking the Select Value button. The modifier can be applied to the Knowledge Skill's Rating by selecting Apply to Rating, otherwise the modifier is applied as a dice pool modifier.

Ignore Condition Monitor Penalty, Stun.name: Ignore Condition Monitor Penalty, Stun
Ignore Condition Monitor Penalty, Stun.page: Reduces the characters Stun Condition Monitor Penalty to 0 while the Improvement is active.

Ignore Condition Monitor Penalty, Physic.name: Ignore Condition Monitor Penalty, Physical
Ignore Condition Monitor Penalty, Physic.page: Reduces the characters Physical Condition Monitor Penalty to 0 while the Improvement is active.

One Good Thing About This Place.name: One Good Thing About This Place

Oaken Stance (Defense Against Being Knoc.name: Oaken Stance (Defense Against Being Knocked Down)

Cat.name: Cat
Cat.advantage: All: +2 dice to either Gymnastics or Sneaking Tests (choose one).
Cat.disadvantage: Cat magicians toy with their prey. Unless you succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test at the start of combat, you cannot make an attack that incapacitates your target. If you take any Physical damage, all this playing around stops.

choice.name: +2 dice on Gymnastics Tests
+2 dice on Sneaking Tests
Magician: +2 dice for Illusion spells
Adept: 2 free levels of Light Body

Dragonslayer.name: Dragonslayer
Dragonslayer.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifier for one social skill of choice.
Dragonslayer.disadvantage: If you break a promise, whether by choice or by accident, you take a –1 dice pool modifier to all actions until you make good on your promise.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Combat spells
Adept: 1 free level of Enhanced Accuracy and Danger Sense

Fire-Bringer.name: Fire-Bringer
Fire-Bringer.advantage: All: +2 dice to Artisan skill tests or Alchemy skill tests (choose one).
Fire-Bringer.disadvantage: When someone sincerely asks you for help, you can’t refuse without succeeding in a Simple Charisma + Willpower (3) Test.

choice.name: +2 dice on Artisan Tests
+2 dice on Alchemy Tests
Magician: +2 dice for Manipulation spells
Adept: 1 free level of Improved Ability on a non-combat skill

Mountain.name: Mountain
Mountain.disadvantage: When a Mountain magician makes a plan, she sticks to it. You must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to abandon a planned course of action in favor of a new one. If you fail, you must endeavor to continue with your original plan, even if it means going on alone. Similarly, you must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to proceed in anything withouta plan.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Counterspelling and anchored rituals
Adept: 1 free level of Mystic Armor

Raven (German).name: Raven (German)
Raven (German).disadvantage: You must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to avoid exploiting someone else’s misfortune to your own advantage or to pull a clever trick or prank even if it’s to the disadvantage of your friends.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Manipulation spells
Adept: Free Traceless Walk
Adept: 1 level of Voice Control

Sea.name: Sea
Sea.disadvantage: You must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to give away something you own or be charitable in some way.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice summoning spirits of water
Adept: 1 free level of Improved Ability on an athletic skill

Seducer.name: Seducer
Seducer.disadvantage: You must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test to avoid pursuing a vice or indulgence (drugs, BTLs, sex, and so on) when it is made available.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion spells
Adept: 1 free level of Improved Ability

Wise Warrior.name: Wise Warrior
Wise Warrior.advantage: All: +2 to dice to Leadership or Instruction skill tests (choose one).
Wise Warrior.disadvantage: If you act dishonorably or without courtesy, whether by choice or by accident, you take a –1 dice pool modifier to all actions until you atone for your behavior.

choice.name: +2 dice for Leadership skill tests
+2 dice for Instruction skill tests
Magician:+2 dice for Combat spells
Adept: 1 free level of Improved Ability on a Combat skill

Peacemaker.name: Peacemaker
Peacemaker.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifier for Negotiation Tests
Peacemaker.disadvantage: You see even enemies as potential friends and go out of your way to keep from hurting anyone unless the situation truly warrants it. At the very beginning of combat, you must pass a Charisma + Intuition (3) Test; failure means you are unable to take actions that cause Physical damage for the duration of combat. At the beginning of a new Combat Turn, you may choose to retake the test if you failed the first time and you or a member of your team suffered damage in the previous Combat Turn.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Detection Spells
Adept: 2 free levels of Enhanced Perception

Oracle.name: Oracle
Oracle.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifier for Arcana Tests
Oracle.disadvantage: You hate mysteries with a passion and can disappear for days trying to track down the answer. When confronted by a particularly haunting question (gamemaster’s discretion), you must take a Willpower + Intuition (3) Test. Failure means you must undertake an Intuition + Logic [Mental] (5, 1 hour) Extended Test to try researching the answer. Completion of the Extended Test does not necessarily mean you found the answer, but it at least silences the question in your mind for the time being. When a follower of Oracle becomes a Grade 1 initiate, she must choose Divination for her first metamagic rather than a Power Point or any other benefit.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Detection Spells
Adept: Free Astral Perception

Doom.name: Doom
Doom.advantage: All: +2 to Demolitions or a single Combat Skill
Doom.disadvantage: Followers of Doom must succeed in a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to avoid a fight once it has begun, or to not enact a plan to do violence. If they fail, they must engage in combat until all opponents are defeated or flee.

choice.name: +2 to Demolitions
+2 to a Combat Skill
Magician: +2 dice for Combat spells
Adept: free Killing Hands

Mutation.name: Mutation
Mutation.advantage: All: +2 dice to a Physical skill
Mutation.disadvantage: If a follower of Mutation finds themselves inferior to an opponent, they suffer a –1 penalty on all actions until they defeat their rival in that area, or overcome or compensate for the weakness in another way (such as acquiring a new power, spell, or augmentation).

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Health Spells
Adept: 2 free levels of Attribute Boost

Pollution.name: Pollution
Pollution.advantage: All: +2 for Chemistry Tests when dealing with pollutants
Pollution.disadvantage: If they are in an area cleaner than their normal habitation, followers of Pollution must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test every day. If they fail, they must spend at least eight hours that day actively despoiling the land, regardless of any other plans they had for that time.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for summoning or binding toxic spirits
Adept: Free Toxic Strike

Great Mother.name: Great Mother
Great Mother.advantage: All: When not in an urban area, gain +1 to any skill test with skills in the Outdoors skill group.
Great Mother.disadvantage: Treat any background count due to pollution or twisted element as twice the actual rating.

choice.name: Magician: +2 for health spells, preparations, and spell rituals.
Adept: Gain Empathic Healing for free.

The Adversary.name: The Adversary
The Adversary.disadvantage: Because of their deep-seated hatred for authority, a teammate’s use of leadership skill is counterproductive to followers of Adversary, invoking either a negative dice penalty or loss of initiative. If the plan doesn’t go the way that the adversary follower wants it to go, it takes a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test for him to get him to cooperate.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Counterspelling and disenchanting
Adept: 1 free level of Iron Will

Monkey.name: Monkey
Monkey.advantage: All: +2 dice to gymnastics tests involving climbing.
Monkey.disadvantage: Because Monkey is not an assassin, the magician must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test in order to strike a surprised opponent. Monkey must be able to watch his prank go off or see the look on the opponent’s face after taunting them, otherwise he suffers –1 to all Magic tests until the next sunrise/sunset.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for spells, preparations, and rituals of the manipulation type.
Adept: 2 free levels of Hang Time.

Oak.name: Oak
Oak.disadvantage: Must have a natural (meaning unaugmented) Body and Strength of 4 or greater to select this mentor spirit.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool bonus when summoning plant or air spirits (choose 1 when selecting this mentor spirit).
Adept: Gain 2 levels of Stillness for free

Artist.name: Artist
Artist.advantage: All: +2 dice to Artisan or Forgery.
Artist.disadvantage: If for more than two weeks the Artist fails to find an audience for a presentation of her ability, she has to make a WIL+ CHA (3) test. Should she fail, she fall into depression (-2 dice for every skill linked to LOG, INT or CHA) for 1d6 days. After that (or if she succeeded in the the WIL+CHA test) a new 14 day period begins in which she has to show off her skills.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion spells.
Adept: 1 free level of Improved Potential.

Blacksmith.name: Blacksmith
Blacksmith.advantage: All: +2 dice to Artisan or Alchemy tests.
Blacksmith.disadvantage: You have to pass a CHA + WIL (3) check to refrain from instantanously avenging an insult.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for summoning spirits of fire.
Adept: 2 free levels of Enhanced Accuracy (skill)

Gambler.name: Gambler
Gambler.disadvantage: Gain the Distinctive Style negative quality.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Manipulation Spells.
Adept: 2 free levels of Danger Sense.

Dachshund.name: Dachshund
Dachshund.disadvantage: A follower of Dachshund must succeed in a WIL+CHA (3) test, to follow the orders of a leader or a abide to a group decision.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Detection Spells.
Adept: 2 free level of Combat Sense.

Electro Marten.name: Electro Marten
Electro Marten.advantage: All: +2 dice to Hardware or Electronic Warfare
Electro Marten.disadvantage: Electro Marten has problems discerning between different signals. A follower of Electro Marten has to succeed in a CHA + WIL (3) test to not lose himself in the signals or hunt after the wrong one. In stressful situations, he is distracted for 3 combat rounds (minus 1 for each success). If he has no successes, he involuntarily attracts attention in the system.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion Spells.
Adept: 1 free level of Elemental Strike.

Klabautermann.name: Klabautermann
Klabautermann.disadvantage: Whenever a follower of Klabautermann is in danger (in reality or only in his imagination) or he has to stay on or in a vehicle for a prolonged time (be it cars, ships, planes or trains), he must make a CHA+WIL(3) test. Should he fail, he is convinced he saw the Klabautermann, resulting in him running scared and trying to flee, as well as trying to convince other characters that their plans will lead to a bad end.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Detection Spells.
Adept: 2 Free levels of Danger Sense.

Luna.name: Luna
Luna.disadvantage: Luna is independent and free. A follower of Luna must pass a CHA+WIL(3) test to follow a direct order that does not correlate to her momentary personal wishes - especially if her own logic tells her that it would be better to disregard her own desires for the moment.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion Spells.
Adept: 2 free levels of Enhanced Accuracy (skill)
Adept: 1 free level of Spell Resistance

Tatzelwurm.name: Tatzelwurm
Tatzelwurm.disadvantage: Combat Junkie quality is gained for free.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for summoning spirits of earth
Adept: 1 free level of Critical Strike.

Wolpertinger.name: Wolpertinger
Wolpertinger.disadvantage: Whenever a follower of Wolpertinger is in danger (in reality or only in his imagination), he has to succeed in a WIL+CHA (3) test to not immediately succumb to his urge to flee.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion Spells.
Adept: 2 free levels of Danger Sense.

Whale.name: Whale
Whale.advantage: All: +2 dice to Swimming or Pilot (Watercraft) skill tests (choose one)
Whale.disadvantage: Because of their personal sense of ethics, followers of the whale must honor any agreement they enter into. This can be an oath to an organization or a verbal contract with a corporation. Failing to honor the contract or oath results in a loss of a point of Magic. The Whale mentor spirit understands if circumstances to complete the contract are out of the Awakened’s hands. For everything else, the follower can attempt to atone, but at the gamemaster’s discretion.

choice.name: +2 dice on Swimming tests
+2 on Pilot (Watercraft) Tests
Magician: +2 to Conjuring skill tests for spirits of water
Adept: Receive 2 ranks in Iron Lungs or free.

Goddess.name: Goddess
Goddess.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Instruction Tests.
Goddess.disadvantage: The Goddess refuses to take a backseat to any male counterparts. Unless you succeed in a Charisma + Willpower Test (3), you will not take orders from a male, or if a male disrespects you, you must respond with equal measure

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Ritual Spellcasting Tests
Adept: 1 free level of Authoritative Tone

Lion.name: Lion
Lion.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Survival Tests, Running Tests, or Tracking Tests (Choose One)
Lion.disadvantage: In combat situations, a Lion will never leave a comrade behind, and will fght to the death to protect an ally. Unless you succeed in a Charisma + Willpower Test (3), you cannot ﬂee combat before your team members are safe. Further, whenever taking actions that don’t beneft the team somehow, your physical and mental limits are reduced by 2.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice to Combat spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: 2 free levels of Attribute Boost (Strength)

Raven (Alt).name: Raven (Alt)
Raven (Alt).advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for knowledge skill tests.
Raven (Alt).disadvantage: Followers of Raven share their mentor’s love of collecting. When presented with data, knowledge, or other gear that would be valuable (gamemaster’s discretion), you must pass a Charisma + Willpower Test (3), or be unable to resist trying to acquiring it.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice to Detection spells, preparations, and rituals.
Magician: +2 dice to summoning spirits if summoner also has Code of Honor: Harmony with Nature, The Shaman’s Code and bargains with the summoned spirit.
Adept: 2 free levels of Enhanced Perception.

Dove.name: Dove
Dove.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Negotiation tests.
Dove.disadvantage: Dove discourages combat whenever possible. As such, those who follow Dove are at –2 dice pool modifer to cast Combat spells or when using lethal force.

choice.name: Magician: +1 dice pool modifer for casting Health spells, +1 dice pool modifer to summon air spirits
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Enhanced Perception.

Planar Entity.name: Planar Entity
Planar Entity.advantage: All: Determined by spirit type and gamemaster approval.
Planar Entity.disadvantage: Taking on an extraplanar entity into one’s soul is not without its drawbacks. Much of their mental ability is taken up keeping themselves from losing their identity as a result of their shared existence. Mages suffer a –2 dice pool penalty when making tests involving Willpower

choice.name: Magician: Determined by spirit type and gamemaster approval.
Adept: Determined by spirit type and gamemaster approval.

Arcana.name: Arcana
Arcana.advantage: All: Once per day, when making a decision or test inﬂuenced by a Tarot reading/card, may re-roll misses as if they had used Edge.
Arcana.disadvantage: Followers of the Arcana must use Tarot decks or individual cards as foci and fetishes, or else take –2 when attempting to use them. The Tarot Arcana plays such a major part in the lives of its adherents that when a follower of Arcana becomes a grade 1 initiate, they must choose centering or adept centering for their frst beneft, with the cards of Tarot being the focus of their centering.

choice.name: Magician: +1 dice pool modifer for casting Detection spells, an additional +2 dice pool modifer to cast Clairvoyance spells.
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Danger Sense

Holy Text.name: Holy Text
Holy Text.advantage: Gain +4 ranks of (Choose Holy Text) Knowledge Skill.
Holy Text.disadvantage: When a follower of a Holy Text wishes to take an action that is contrary to the teaching of the text (whatever that text is), they must pass a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test to take the action.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when using the Banishing skill.
Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Health spells.
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Mystic Armor or Empathic Healing (choose one).

Death.name: Death
Death.advantage: All: +4 ranks of the Knowledge Skill Anatomy, Disease, Infected, or Undead (choose one).
Death.disadvantage: In order for a follower of Death to attempt to help someone who is dying or injured, they must frst pass a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting the spells Death Touch, Manaball, Manabolt, One Less, Slaughter, Slay.
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Killing Hands or Plague Cloud (choose one).

War.name: War
War.advantage: All: After character creation, may purchase combat skills at rank 3 or higher for 1 less Karma
War.disadvantage: If it looks as if they are going to lose a battle, those with the War mentor must pass a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test, or else use all means necessary—including the lives, nuyen, and honor of their teammates—to overcome their adversary.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Combat spells, preparations, and rituals.
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Critical Strike.

Tohu Wa-Bohu.name: Tohu Wa-Bohu
Tohu Wa-Bohu.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Intimidation or Demolitions tests (choose one)
Tohu Wa-Bohu.disadvantage: Followers gain the Driven quality, in which the focus is the opportunity to destroy something meaningful. Further, they fnd it hard to work in groups given their destructive nature. They can never beneft from teamwork or leadership bonuses.

choice.name: Magician: Gain the Witness My Hate quality for free.
Adept: Gain the Adept Accident power for free.

Sun.name: Sun
Sun.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for Perception tests when outside during the day.
Sun.disadvantage: Followers of Sun must pass a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test in order to purposefully deceive others.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Sun- or Fire-based spells.
Adept: Gain 3 free levels of Temperature Tolerance

Dark King.name: Dark King
Dark King.disadvantage: Followers receive a –1 dice pool penalty when resisting physical damage.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice to Contractual Rituals.
Adept: Gain Spirit Ram for free.

Moon.name: Moon
Moon.disadvantage: Followers of Moon must make a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test in order to engage in direct confrontation; failure means they cannot make any action considered as such. Negotiation is not considered confrontation (Moon loves discussion), but arguments fall into that category.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice for Illusion and transformation-focused Manipulation spells, preparations, and spell rituals.
Adept: Gain 3 levels of Stillness for free.

Stag.name: Stag
Stag.disadvantage: Followers of the Stag demand respect, especially to those they give it to. Once disrespected, they must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) Test, or they will demand satisfaction against the slight.

choice.name: Magician: +2 to summoning earth spirits.
Adept: Gain +2 levels of Light Body for free.

Spider (Alt).name: Spider (Alt)
Spider (Alt).advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Stealth skill group.
Spider (Alt).disadvantage: When not following a plan or a plan doesn’t go according to plan, followers of Spider must pass a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test or suffer –2 to all rolls until a new plan is established.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Manipulation spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Spirit Claw (although in this case, it manifests as a fang).

Wolf (Alt).name: Wolf (Alt)
Wolf (Alt).advantage: All: +1 dice pool modifer for tests using the Sneaking, Perception, Survival, and Tracking skills.
Wolf (Alt).disadvantage: Whenever a follower of Wolf sees an opportunity to survive by attacking or sacrifcing the weak, they must pass a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test or attempt to seize the opportunity. This does not apply to those the Wolf considers friends or family.

choice.name: Magician: +1 dice pool modifer when casting Combat spells, preparations, and rituals.
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Danger Sense.

Rat (Alt).name: Rat (Alt)
Rat (Alt).advantage: All: +1 dice pool modifer for tests using the Perception and Sneaking skills.
Rat (Alt).disadvantage: Followers of Rat cannot receive aid or aid others with a Teamwork test unless they trust the individuals they are teaming with. Further, if they do trust the individuals, but that trust is broken through incompetence or betrayal, they must pass a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test to be able to use teamwork with that individual each time in the future.

choice.name: Magician: +1 dice pool modifer when casting Health spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Analytics.

Eurasian Jay.name: Eurasian Jay
Eurasian Jay.advantage: All: +1 dice pool modifer for tests using the Perception and Palming skills.
Eurasian Jay.disadvantage: Eurasian Jay loves to split his posessions. If a follower of Eurasian Jay receives a splittable reward, she must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) test to not spread the reward over different accounts or rooms.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Illusion spells, preparations, and rituals
Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Manipulation spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Voice Control.
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Danger Sense.

Squirrel.name: Squirrel
Squirrel.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Gymnastics skill.
Squirrel.disadvantage: When followers of Squirrel are in confined spaces, they must make a Willpower + Chrisma (3) Tets or take a -1 dice pool modifier on all tests while feeling cramped.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Detection spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Light Body.

Tide.name: Tide
Tide.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Ritual Spellcasting skill.
Tide.disadvantage: Followers of Tide live in transition, but in the consistency of a cycle. They also design their lives this way. If their normal life cycle is lastingly impaired by Sleep deprivation or illness, they suffer a -1 dice pool modifier on all tests until the cycle is restored.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice summoning spirits of water or earth (The type of spirit for which this bonus applies changes every 6 hours).
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Heightened Concentration.

Heinzelm\u00e4nnchen.name: Heinzelmännchen
Heinzelm\u00e4nnchen.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Artisan skill and the Engineering skill group.
Heinzelm\u00e4nnchen.disadvantage: Heinzelmännchen works in secret. If a follower of Heinzelmännchen wants to perform magic in public or under close observation, they'll have to make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test or else their magic cease to function for the moment.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Manipulation spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Improved Ability (Artisan or a skill from the Engineering group).

Groundhog.name: Groundhog
Groundhog.advantage: All: +1 dice pool modifer for tests using the Perception and Etiquette skills.
Groundhog.disadvantage: If a follower of Grounghog get into a fight (intentionally or unintentionally), they'll have to make a Willpower + Chraisma (3) Test to not flee immediately.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Detection spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 2 free levels of Attribute Boost (Reaction).
Adept: Gain the Motion Sense power for free.

Pig.name: Pig
Pig.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Con skill.
Pig.disadvantage: A follower of Pig must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to break free from pleasurable activities like sleeping, eating, drinking or consuming drugs.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice pool modifer when casting Manipulation spells, preparations, and rituals
Adept: Gain 1 free level of Improved Ability for a skill from the Influence or Acting group.

Capricorn.name: Capricorn
Capricorn.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Gymnastics skill.
Capricorn.disadvantage: Capricorn may not be stubborn, but he decides and acts quickly. He has neither tolerance nor time for hesitation. If a follower of Capricorn is confronted with long decision-making processes, discussions, or indecision, he must make a Charisma + Willpower (3) test in order not to immediately choose the in his opinion best decision available and to put it into practice immediately.

choice.name: Magician: +2 dice summoning spirits of earth.
Adept: 2 free levels of Hang Time.

Wild Hunt.name: Wild Hunt
Wild Hunt.advantage: All: +2 dice pool modifer for tests using the Pilot Ground Craft or Intimidation skill.
Wild Hunt.disadvantage: A follower of the Wild Hunt always leaves behind a swath of devastation. If objects or uninvolved persons could be harmed in the fight, he wouldn't take any consideration. If a follower of the Wild Hunt is consciously considerate in the fight, he must succeed in a Charisma + Willpower (3) test, otherwise he is so inhibited that he suffers a -2 dicepool modifier on all actions.

choice.name: +2 dice on Pilot Ground Craft Tets
+2 dice on Intimidation Tets
Magician: +2 dice summoning spirits of man.
Magician: +2 dice summoning guardian spirits.
Adept: Gain the Berserk power for free.

quality: Code of Honor: Like a Boss
Did You Just Call Me Dumb?
Code of Honor: Like a Boss
Did You Just Call Me Dumb?
Code of Honor: Like a Boss
Did You Just Call Me Dumb?
Code of Honor: Like a Boss
Did You Just Call Me Dumb?

name.@select: The Art of War, The Book of Five Rings, The Tale of the Heike, and other assorted samurai writings and poetry

01.advantage: +1 die for compiling and registering sprites of any type
01.disadvantage: Zero-One is the perfection of the code and demands the same from his followers, or at least teaches them a harsh lesson if they fail. Zero-One technomancers must spend 2 points of Edge to negate a glitch or downgrade a critical glitch.

Alias.name: Alias
Alias.disadvantage: Alias technomancers cannot abide to pay for their lifestyle and must therefore use their abilities to spoof their lifestyle.

choice.name: +1 die for Crack spirtes
+1 dice for Sleuth Sprites

Abort.name: Abort
Abort.disadvantage: An Abort technomancer must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to take any other action in cybercombat except for trying to crash his opponent’s software.

choice.name: +1 dice for dissonant Crack sprites
+1 dice for dissonant Fault sprites
+1 die for Data sprites
+1 die for Machine sprites

Babel.name: Babel
Babel.advantage: +1 to online Etiquette and Language Tests, +1 die for Courier or Tutor sprites (player must choose one)
Babel.disadvantage: Secrecy is the bane of communication, so Babel technomancers must make a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to encrypt anything.

choice.name: +1 die for Courier sprites
+1 die for Tutor sprites

The Black Hat.name: The Black Hat
The Black Hat.disadvantage: Black Hat technomancers have extreme difficulty restraining themselves from hacking into a node that is interesting in any way. The technomancer must succeed in a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to avoid hacking such a system when the opportunity arises.

choice.name: +1 die for Crack sprites
+1 die for Fault sprites

Cryptome.name: Cryptome
Cryptome.advantage: +2 dice to all Encryption and Decryption Tests
Cryptome.disadvantage: Technomancers who follow Cryptome don’t surrender secrets easily and never to unreliable sources. The technomancer must make a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to share a secret or important information with someone he does not completely trust … and such trust is rare.

choice.name: +1 die for Courier sprites
+1 die for Data sprites

Daedalus.name: Daedalus
Daedalus.disadvantage: Technomancers who follow Daedalus tend to interact with the machines on which they are working in an even more subconscious manner than usual. As a result, modifications they make are geared towards someone with their talents and worldview, rather than something that is intuitive to a mundane user or even a non-Daedalus technomancer. Devices built or modified by such technomancers have a more arcane user interface, imposing a –2 modifier on anyone who wants to legitimately use it.

choice.name: +1 die for Machine sprites
+1 die for Fault sprites

Delphi.name: Delphi
Delphi.disadvantage: Delphi technomancers don’t adapt easily to unexpected situations. They must make a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to make any quick decisions in situations they have not planned for.

choice.name: +1 die for Code sprites
+1 die for Tutor sprites

Disinformation.name: Disinformation
Disinformation.advantage: +1 die to all test with skills from the Influence skill group
Disinformation.disadvantage: Disinformants must succeed in a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to pass truthful, complete, or non-doctored information via the Matrix to non-dissonant technomancers.

choice.name: +1 die for dissonant Data sprites
+1 die for dissonant Tutor sprites

Echelon.name: Echelon
Echelon.advantage: +1 die to Track and Sniffer Tests
Echelon.disadvantage: Echelon followers obsessively work to gather information about what is going on around them. When caught off-guard, without having information they need, or when running blind into a situation, they suffer a –1 dice pool modifier on all actions as long as the situation remains.

choice.name: +1 die for Crack sprites
+1 die for Sleuth sprites
+1 die for Code sprites
+1 die for Data sprites

Idoru.name: Idoru
Idoru.disadvantage: Idoru followers must succeed in a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to avoid manipulating data in their favor when the opportunity affords.

choice.name: +1 die for Crack sprites
+1 die for Sleuth sprites

Intrusion Countermeasure (IC).name: Intrusion Countermeasure (IC)
Intrusion Countermeasure (IC).advantage: +2 dice to all Matrix Damage Resistance Tests except Fading, +1 die for Paladin sprites
Intrusion Countermeasure (IC).disadvantage: If an IC technomancer fails to protect or guard something he has committed to, or does not achieve a self-chosen goal, he suffers a –1 dice pool modifier on all actions until he atones for the failure.

Jormungand.name: Jormungand
Jormungand.disadvantage: Jormungand technomancers are destructive and will take every opportunity to devastate a node by permanently deleting or corrupting its data. They must succeed in a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to leave a node they have hacked into unscathed.

choice.name: +1 die for dissonant Data sprites
+1 die for dissonant Code sprites

Nemesis.name: Nemesis
Nemesis.disadvantage: A Nemesis technomancer must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to restrain himself from punishing those whom he feels deserve it.

choice.name: +1 die for dissonant Fault sprites
+1 die for dissonant Sleuth sprites

Noise.name: Noise
Noise.disadvantage: Noise technomancers rely on the buzz of Matrix more so than others, and suffer double the modifiers applied to Matrix and non-Matrix actions when caught in static or dead zones (see p. 210, SR4).

choice.name: +1 die for dissonant Courier sprites
+1 die for dissonant Code sprites

Probe.name: Probe
Probe.disadvantage: Probe technomancers receive a –2 dice penalty when hacking on the fly without probing first.

choice.name: +1 die for Crack sprites
+1 die for Sleuth sprites

Shooter.name: Shooter
Shooter.advantage: +2 dice to all Matrix Attack Tests
Shooter.disadvantage: A Shooter technomancer must succeed in a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to retreat from a Matrix fight.

choice.name: +1 die for Paladin sprites
+1 die for Tank sprites
+1 die for dissonant Crack sprites
+1 die for dissonant Tank sprites

The World Tree.name: The World Tree
The World Tree.disadvantage: World Tree technomancers are easily distracted by information they find interesting. When faced with new information, unusual data, or phenomena, the technomancer must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to resist dropping his current task to screen, analyze, and acquire the information (if possible).

choice.name: +1 die for Code sprites
+1 die for Courier sprites
